TourInfo.Description: As with all our vacations, this itinerary features specially-organized sightseeing and first-hand experiences throughout. Sightseeing, special features and scenic highlights as indicated in the itinerary, including admission charges Headsets for sightseeing so you can easily hear your guide's commentary Hidden Delight A unique experience provided by your Travel Director

strong: Welcome to Hawaii! In the traditional Aloha spirit, youll be greeted at the airport with a fragrant lei, and your complimentary transfer will take you to your tour hotel. Meet your Travel Director at the hotel this afternoon. At 6 p.m., gather at the hotel for a Hawaiian-Style Welcome Reception.

Visit Pearl Harbor and the USS Arizona Memorial. Then travel on to Punchbowl Crater and the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific. Return to downtown Honolulu to see Iolani Palace, the King Kamehameha I statue and the state capitol building. Next, visit a coral jewelry workshop, a Local Specialty. Spend the rest of the afternoon at leisure before joining your Travel Director for a Highlight Dinner at a local restaurant.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Oahu / Hawaii Volcanoes National Park / Kona

strong: Fly to Hilo on the Big Island of Hawaii and then set out for Volcanoes National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Look out on spectacular views of the caldera and crater and learn about the geology of the islands at the Jaggar Museum. Then walk through a real lava tube. After an included lunch, visit a local coffee farm and mill and savor a tasting of 100% Kona coffee, a Local Specialty. Reach the coast and check in to your oceanfront resort.

Explore one of the most beautiful areas in the world on your own today. With a full day at leisure, your options abound: snorkel, look for green sea turtles at Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park, ride on a submarine, or relax at your resort. This evening, perhaps take a sunset cruise (all own expense).

Fly to Maui and travel into the countryside to visit a Unique Insight at Kahanu Aina Organic Sprouts Farm. Then enjoy a glass of wine and indulge in a Youre Personally Invited lunch featuring the finest local ingredients. Continue to Kaanapali Beach.

Full day on Maui. Explore the old whaling village of Lahaina. Play at a championship golf course overlooking the ocean, ascend to the summit of Mount Haleakala to see the sunrise, or make the journey to the remote town of Hana. During your stay, a presentation by a Local Expert teaches you about the exotic flora and fauna of the islands. Enjoy a festive Luau Highlight Dinner.

Full day on Maui. Explore the old whaling village of Lahaina. Play at a championship golf course overlooking the ocean, ascend to the summit of Mount Haleakala to see the sunrise, or make the journey to the remote town of Hana. During your stay, a presentation by a Local Expert teaches you about the exotic flora and fauna of the islands.

Fly to the Garden Isle of Kauai. Cruise along the Wailua River, passing rainforests and the Sleeping Giant mountain ridge. Stroll to the Fern Grotto where Hawaiian dancers and singers will perform traditional songs and hula. A riverside Lunch completes the tour before heading to your beautiful oceanfront resort.
Spend a glorious day on Kauai. Maybe take a trip to Waimea Canyon, travel by boat or helicopter to the Na Pali Coast or just relax and enjoy the pool at your resort.

Spend a glorious day on Kauai. Maybe take a trip to Waimea Canyon, travel by boat or helicopter to the Na Pali Coast or just relax and enjoy the pool at your resort. On this final night on Kauai, gather for a festive Farewell Dinner.
You are transferred to Lihue Airport where your vacation ends.
Aloha Welcome with fresh flower lei
Airport transfers in Honolulu on Day 1 and Kauai on Day 11
Twin-bedded rooms in hotels listed or similar; hotel taxes, service charges and tips for baggage handling
Welcome Reception with light appetizers and drinks
10 full breakfasts; 3 lunches, including You're Personally Invited lunch with wine; 4 dinners, including Highlight Dinner with wine, Highlight Dinner with open bar and Farewell Dinner with wine
Services of a professional Travel Director
Luxury motorcoach with air conditioning, reclining seats and onboard restroom
A Brendan Vacations Bonus - All inter-island flights Oahu/Hawaii and Hawaii/Maui and Maui/Kauai, and all airport transfers

strong: Welcome to Toronto, Canadas largest city! After checking into your hotel, take advantage of some time on your own to relax or explore the hustle and bustle of the city. At 6 p.m., gather at the hotel with your Travel Director and fellow travelers for a Welcome Reception.

Start the day with an orientation tour of cosmopolitan Toronto, viewing Casa Loma, the massive castle residence built by a Toronto financier during the early 20th century; sprawling Queens Park; the lively entertainment district; stately University Avenue and the Provincial Legislative Buildings. The remainder of the day and evening are yours to explore this exciting city on your own or perhaps embark on an optional excursion to the top of the iconic CN Tower.

Experience the majesty of one of the worlds great natural wonders. Travel through the lush wine-growing region between Lake Erie and Lake Ontario before arriving at Niagara Falls. Enjoy a panoramic view of the falls before boarding the Maid of the Mist for an exhilarating boat ride to the base of spec- tacular Horseshoe Falls. Theres time for shopping and picture taking on the Canadian side of the falls. This evening, enjoy a delightful experience at a family-owned and operated winery. Join your hosts for an exclusive tour and wine tasting of their award-winning wines, including their famous ice wine, a specialty of the region, made from grapes that have been frozen while still on the vine. The result: a refreshingly sweet dessert wine. Later, sample some of Niagaras regional cuisine created with local seasonal ingredients at a Youre Personally Invited dinner served in a marvelous setting with views of the vineyard.

Heading north, follow the scenic shores of Lake Ontario through the Ontario countryside to the historic city of Kingston. Here, visit Old Fort Henry, a 19th century British military fortress, and learn about British garrison life during the years just before the confederation of Canada was born, arising from three former British colonies. This evening, enjoy a Highlight Dinner cruise across Kingstons Thousand Islands region.

Follow the thread of the nations history in Upper Canada Village, a re-created rural community where costumed interpreters immerse you in 1860s life. Explore more than 40 businesses and homes, including a blacksmith shop, a schoolhouse and sawmill. Then travel to Montreal, the cultural capital of French Canada and the largest French-speaking city outside of France. Here, your Local Guide introduces you to the historic sites of the city, including spectacular Notre-Dame Basilica, and the colorful port area and the modern, bustling downtown. Stop at Mount Royal the hill that gave its name to the city for panoramic views over one of the loveliest cities in North America.

This morning, wind your way along the beautiful St. Lawrence River, stopping at thundering Montmorency Falls, cascading down from nearly 100 feet taller than those at Niagara. On the way to Quebec City, enjoy a stop at a family-owned Copper Art Museum, a Local Specialty, where you will see a demonstration of how copper ore is transformed into beautiful works of art and browse the art gallery. Youll even get to try your hand at creating a copper keepsake! This afternoon, find yourself within the fortified walls of old-world Quebec City with its artisanal bakeries, flower markets and lively cafes, offering a taste of Paris in the New World. Tonight, enjoy dinner at a local restaurant.

Join your Local Guide on an exploration of the city, walking the narrow streets of the atmospheric Old Town and the Plains of Abraham, the site of a major colonial battle between the British and the French. Enjoy the afternoon on your own. Perhaps browse the citys shops and galleries, visit a museum or simply sit and watch the world go by at a charming sidewalk cafe.

Travel back into Ontario to Ottawa, Canadas stately capital. Upon arrival, embark on an introductory tour of the city, viewing the elegant buildings of Parliament Hill, Rideau Hall, the residence of the Governor General of Canada, and the beautiful downtown parks with their exquisite gardens.

The day is yours to spend as you like, immersed in the history and culture of Canadas lively capital. Stop at a gallery or two, explore one of Ottawas many museums, or visit Rideau Canala UNESCO World Heritage Site that becomes the worlds largest skating rink in the winter months. Tonight, toast to your Eastern Canada adventure with newfound friends at a festive Farewell Dinner.
Return to Toronto where you are transferred to Toronto International Airport or the hotel if youd like to extend your stay. Please do not schedule any flights before 6 p.m.

strong: Welcome to Auckland! Your vacation begins as you are transferred to your hotel. After check-in, you are free to explore Auckland on your own. This evening, gather with your Travel Director and fellow travelers for a Welcome Drink followed by dinner.

See Auckland on a sightseeing tour. Then travel south, tracing the Waikato River to the Waitomo Caves to tour the amazing Glow Worm Grotto with a Local Guide. Continue on to Rotorua, where you will take in views of Lake Rotorua and more on an orientation tour. Tonight enjoy a Youre Personally Invited Maori Hangi feast and concert for an insight into Maori culture at the Tamaki Family Marae.

Watch the Agrodome Sheep Show, a Local Specialty, then the afternoon is yours. Your optional outing tonight is The Realm of Tane, a journey through Maori culture, mythology and our story of creation. Tonight you have a chance to stay with a local family on a nearby farm and enjoy genuine Kiwi hospitality including dinner and your own private room with shared bathroom for an additional charge of $70 per person.

Heading south, youll view the Huka Falls. Visit Taupo. Drive along the shores of New Zealands biggest lake, through the alpine scenery of Mt. Ruapehu. Tongariro National Park and the dairy farms of Manawatu. Then its along the Kapiti Coast to Wellington for a sightseeing tour.
After a morning of free time in Wellington, visit Te Papa followed by Parliament House. Then cruise on Queen Charlotte Sound. Later travel to the seaside village of Picton for an orientation tour.

Its your chance to get up close and personal with some New Zealand fur seals at Ohau Point, and watch whales at Kaikoura, (optional scenic Whale Watching flight). Travel along the rugged Pacific Ocean coast, and across the patchwork Canterbury Plains, to Christchurch.

After a morning at leisure, travel over the patchwork countryside of the Canterbury Plains, where the spectacular sightseeing begins. Lake Tekapo and Lake Pukaki are first up. Next youll visit the Church of the Good Shepherd before soaking up the sensational alpine landscape of Mt. Cook National Park (optional scenic flight).

Your day starts along the Waitaki River with the Waitaki Hydro Power Scheme and Benmore Dam. Travel through Oamaru with its famous white limestone buildings to Dunedin, for a city tour. Then you have the afternoon to yourself  take an optional Wildlife Cruise, visit the Cadbury Chocolate Factory or ride the historic Taieri Gorge Railway.

After a morning of free time, during which you might like to take an optional tour of New Zealands Larnach Castle, head off across South Otagos fertile, sheep-filled farming land en route to Te Anau, on the shores of the largest lake in the South Island. Tonight you may choose to travel by boat to the Te Anau Glow Worm Caves.

Youll be awe-struck by great sights from Fiordland National Park to Milford Sound, where you will cruise on the waters of this natural wonder. Along the way to Queenstown, see Mirror Lake, Cleddau Valley, the Chasm, Mitre Peak, Bowen Falls and travel along the Devils Staircase and the shores of Lake Wakatipu. At Queenstown youll have an orientation tour on arrival and enjoy dinner with views over Lake Wakatipu and the Remarkables.

Explore exciting Queenstown your way, all day. This evening, cruise across Lake Wakatipu aboard New Zealands oldest steamship, the TSS Earnslaw, to Walter Peak Station for a carvery Highlight Dinner at the Colonels Homestead. An entertaining after-dinner farm show provides a glimpse into high-country farm life.

First stop, Arrowtown, on the Arrow River, and then Cromwell for its sensational stone fruit, a Local Specialty. Next see lakes Dunstan, Hawea and Wanaka. Through the Haast Pass, you view Thunder Creek Falls and enjoy a rainforest walk. Final stop, majestic Fox Glacier. Take the opportunity for an optional scenic flight over the glacier.

Visit Hokitika, home of the native greenstone (jade), a Local Specialty, for a factory visit and jewelry demonstration. Then travel through Greymouth to Arthurs Pass to board the TranzAlpine, a spectacular journey through the Southern Alps and across the Canterbury Plains to Christchurch. This evening gather for a Farewell Dinner with your Travel Director and newfound friends.
After breakfast, you will be transferred to Christchurch Airport whereyour vacation ends.
Airport transfers in Auckland on Day 1 and Christchurch on Day 14 for guests who have advised Brendan of their flight details

TourInfo.TourName: Rockies Thrills and Glacier Chills with Calgary Stampede
TourInfo.Description: As with all our vacations, this itinerary features specially-organized sightseeing and first-hand experiences throughout. Sightseeing, special features and scenic highlights as indicated in the itinerary, including admission charges Headsets for sightseeing so you can easily hear your guide's commentary Hidden Delight A unique experience provided by your Travel Director

strong: Get ready for a thrilling adventure with your family and friends in the eye-popping Coast Mountains and Canadian Rockies, combining spectacular natural wonders with river rafting, canoeing, hiking and more. Check into your hotel and get settled. At 6 p.m., gather at the hotel with your Travel Director and fellow adventurers for a festive Kick-off Party.

Start your morning with a brief city tour of Vancouver including Gastown, Chinatown and Stanley Park. Then, travel the scenic Sea-to- Sky Highway, stopping to visit the Britannia Mine Museum. Descend by train into the depths of this historic mining tunnel and try your luck panning for gold. Arrive in Whistler and stop in at the Sports Museum and learn about some of the athletic history of this city that hosted the 2010 Winter Olympic Games. This afternoon, choose from two options: head out on a guided two hour bike tour through this popular summer outdoor mecca, or visit the Squamish Lilwat Cultural Centre to learn about two different First Nations of British Columbia. Then, hold your breath when you look more than 1,300 feet straight down from the worlds highest and longest gondola ride, the Peak 2 Peak Alpine Experience between Whistler and Blackcomb Mountains. This evening, enjoy a Highlight Dinner at a local restaurant.

Step back in time with a visit to historic Hat Creek Ranch. Interpreters in period clothing bring alive the tales of this 1860s roadhouse, which catered to miners and wagon trains. Stroll through the apple orchard, view the antique farming equipment and explore the ranch buildings. Walk along Hat Creek to the native village of the Shuswap Nation where members share their captivating culture. Continue to Kamloops and check into your hotel. Tonight, rally your mateys for an evening of miniature golf.

Travel into the majestic Rocky Mountains, via the scenic Yellowhead Highway. Stop for a knock-out view of Mount Robson, the highest peak in the Canadian Rockies. Upon arriving in Jasper, you and your family will face two thrilling choices  either get splashed on a riproaring white water rafting adventure on the mighty Athabasca River or take a gentle float trip on calmer waters. Whichever you choose, youll marvel at the magnificent landscapes of Jasper National Park. After dinner, enjoy a fun presentation on the parks wildlife with a Local Expert.

Spend today rockin the Rockies as you like, or choose from optional outdoor activities. Ask your family members for a quick vote on whether to take a scenic cruise on the pristine Maligne Lake or if they want to don their hiking boots for a guided alpine walk for oohing and aahing beneath the splendor of Mount Edith Cavell.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Jasper / Icefields Parkway / Lake Louise / Banff

strong: Now that youve done some thrillin, time to start the chillin as you travel along the stunning Icefields Parkway and the amazing Columbia Icefield, the largest reservoir of ice and snow in the Rocky Mountains. Ride out on the massive Athabasca Glacier ice sheet aboard a specially designed Ice Explorer and learn amazing facts about glaciers and their impact on the environment. Travel on to Banff National Park for another peak experience. As you step out at Bow Summit, the highest point on the Columbia Icefield, marvel at the turquoise color of glacier-fed Peyto Lake below. Travel on to the ultimate postcard-setting, Lake Louise, where you can do some chillin on your own  maybe paddle your own canoe across the emerald clear waters or take a leisurely hike along the shore. Tonight, settle into the welcoming mountain community of Banff.

Strike out on your own this morning with an optional helicopter flight over Mount Assiniboine. Then, get going with one Rocky Mountain high after another. View beautiful Bow Falls, majestic Tunnel Mountain Drive, Surprise Corner and Sulphur Mountain. Play a game of What creature do you see? as you spot the whimsical hoodoos overlooking Bow Valley. This afternoon, you can opt to put on your boots and bandanas for some spectacular horseback riding, following the trail along the Bow River and hanging on to your hat at the Windy Knoll Viewpoint. Tonight, join the gang at a Farewell Dinner pizza night with a rousing game of bowling celebrating this high-scoring family experience.

Depart Banff this morning and youre off to the Calgary Stampede, the Greatest Outdoor Show on Earth. Your all-day tickets include reserved seating at rodeo events and admission to the Stampede Park. Tonight, watch the Stampedes Chuckwagon Races. End the day with the Grandstand Show musical extravaganza and fireworks!
Take a complimentary transfer to Calgary International Airport.
Airport transfers in Vancouver on Day 1 and in Calgary on Day 8

strong: Welcome to Washington, D.C. A complimentary transfer is provided to the tour hotel. At 6 p.m., gather at the hotel with your fellow travelers for a Welcome Reception.

Join a Local Guide on your Small Group sightseeing tour to view the White House, Washington Monument and the National Mall. Reflect on the countrys most turbulent days at the Lincoln Memorial and the World War II memorial. Next, visit Arlington National Cemetery and learn about the final resting place of the nations heroes. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure  visit one of the Smithsonian Institutions museums or stroll around the Dupont Circle neighborhood.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Washington DC / Philadelphia / New York City

strong: Travel up the Atlantic seaboard to the City of Brotherly Love. Take in the views of Independence Hall and visit the Liberty Bell. There is time on your own to explore Independence National Historic Park. Then on to New York City. Venture out to the pulsating streets of Times Square before a delicious dinner at a Manhattan restaurant.

ItinerarySegment.Title: New York City Sightseeing & at Leisure

strong: Take a tour of the citys highlights with a Local Guide. View the site of the former World Trade Center and the construction site of the new Freedom Tower. See the Empire State Building, the mirrored peak of the iconic Chrysler Building and grand Central Park. Visit Battery Park from where you can see the Statue of Liberty, a gift from the people of France. Then ride the elevator to the Top of the Rock, the 70th floor of the Rockefeller Building, for a sweeping view of Manhattan. The rest of the day is yours to enjoy.

Boston is awash in history, from the Old North Church, made famous in Longfellows poem about Paul Reveres midnight ride, to the Cambridge campus of Harvard University, the nations oldest. This afternoon, get to know Bostons most famous beer with a tour and tasting at the Samuel Adams Brewery, a Local Specialty. This evening, savor dinner at a special Your Choice Dining experience where you select your dining location from four of Bostons renowned eateries.

A full day to explore Boston your way. Stroll the green spaces of the Boston Common (and perhaps take a ride on one of the famous Swan Boats in the Public Garden) or discover the continental art at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.

Once the destination of choice of the Astors, Vanderbilts and Carnegies of the world, the beautiful seaside town of Newport offers a wealth of architectural landmarks and enter- taining stories of life among the 19th century rich and famous. See the rows of mansions along Ocean Drive before touring The Breakers, the 70-room Italianate palace Cornelius Vanderbilt called his cottage. Returning to Boston, raise a glass with your newfound friends at a festive Farewell Dinner.
A complimentary transfer is provided to Boston Logan International Airport, where your vacation ends.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Arrive in Phoenix / Scottsdale

strong: Howdy partners! Check in and enjoy a refreshing dip in the hotels pool before gussying up for the 6 p.m. Kick-off Party with your traveling buddies.

ItinerarySegment.Accommodation: Hilton Garden Inn Scottsdale Old Town

strong: A drive through the Sonoran Desert brings you to Montezuma Castle National Monument, one DAY of the best preserved cliff dwellings in North America and once home to the Sinagua Indians. Next its onto Sedona, in spectacular Red Rock Country, for a rip-roarin jeep ride into Dry Creek Basin. At the old Van Deren Cabin, learn what it was really like to be a cowboy in the Old West. Drive through Oak Creek Canyon and ponderosa pine forests before arriving in the railroad town of Williams.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Williams / Grand Canyon Railway / Grand Canyon

strong: This morning, watch out for the infamous Cataract Creek Gang! Climb aboard the historic Grand Canyon Railway, passing through ponderosa pines, the high desert and the Kaibab National Forest while hearing folklore about the area. Nothing on earth can prepare you for the Grand Canyon, one of the natural wonders of the world. With a Local Expert, youll learn how the Grand Canyon was formed and become a rock expert yourself as you examine samples from the sedimentary layers. As the sun sets, join your Travel Director for an unforgettable walk along the rim.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Grand Canyon / Monument Valley / Lake Powell

strong: Drive along Desert View Drive before entering Navajo Country. Here you can poke around the historic Cameron Trading Post and hunt for a piece of Southwest Native American art. Next stop, the Code Talkers Exhibit in Kayenta. See why Monument Valley is a favorite location for movie directors, as you are bouncing along the valley floor in an open-air vehicle, witnessing the magnificent mesas. Wrap up your exciting day at a lakeside resort at Lake Powell. Kick off your boots and have some fun at a poolside pizza dinner! After, enjoy a slide show presentation by a Local Expert all about the striking geology and survival strategies of the desert wildlife of the Canyonlands.
Enjoy a free day to roam the range. Choose an optional activity or maybe dive into some of the many aquatic activities at Lake Powell Marina.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Lake Powell / Zion & Bryce Canyon National Parks

strong: Youll be awestruck by spectacular Zion Canyon. Riding the parks shuttle, marvel at how the Virgin River cut through the sandstone to create this natural wonder. Take an easy trek to the Emerald Pools, for splendid views and waterfalls. Theres also a more strenuous hike to Angels Landing. Leaving Zion, drive along the Mount Carmel Highway and watch out for more spectacular formations like the Great Arch of Zion and the distinctive Checkerboard Mesa before arriving at Bryce Canyon.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Bryce Canyon National Park Sightseeing & free time

strong: Exploring Bryce Canyon is like entering a weird and eerie world of bizarre shapes, including slot canyons, windows, fins, and spires called hoodoos. Explore the rim of a great amphitheater stopping at various look-outs to snap pictures. This afternoon youre free to blaze your own trail. Later, put on your cowboy boots for a Western Farewell Dinner.

Travel through the scenic Virgin River Gorge to fabulous Las Vegas, where your adventures in the great West come to an end. You are transferred to Las Vegas International Airport, or if youre extending your stay, to the hotel in Las Vegas. Please do not schedule any flights before 6:30 p.m.
Airport transfers in Phoenix on Day 1 and Las Vegas on Day 8

Must-see sightseeing, surprise extras, and scenic highlights headsets for sightseeing so you can easily hear your guides commentary hidden treasure A unique experience provided by your Travel Director

strong: Board your overnight transatlantic flight.

At 2 p.m., your voyage of discovery begins on a city tour. Visit St. Patricks Cathedral, see the Georgian squares, and walk the cobbled courtyards of Trinity College to its library and world treasure, the 8th-century Book of Kells. Later, gather for a Welcome Dinner with Irish beer or wine at a favorite pub.
Head to fabled Blarney Castle. Theres time to kiss the famous stone that gives the gift of eloquence. Then on to Killarney, the lively town on the lakes.

Travel the road that winds around the beautiful Ring of Kerry. Mountains, valleys, lakes, and sea blend into a landscape that is often breathtaking beyond words. Stopping at Torc Waterfall, there is a chance to join a leisurely hike. For those who do not want to hike, the motorcoach will return you to Killarney, where the rest of the day is free. B NOTE: The hike travels over wooded paths and lakeshore trails. While there are no mountains to climb, walkers need to be fit, have good walking shoes or boots, sunscreen and raingear. Approx. 3 miles/2 hours

Travel north, crossing the Shannon Estuary by ferry. Continue to the majestic Cliffs of Moher rising 700 feet above the pounding Atlantic waves. On to Bunratty. Tonight, attend a Medieval Castle Banquet - a festive way to end your Ireland vacation!
You will be transferred to Shannon Airport where your vacation ends. Perhaps extend your vacation with extra nights in Bunratty or return to Dublin and stay in Ireland longer!

TourInfo.Description: As with all our vacations, this itinerary features specially-organized sightseeing and first-hand experiences throughout. Must-see sightseeing and scenic highlights Headsets for sightseeing so you can easily hear your guides commentary

strong: Board your overnight transatlantic flight.

Welcome to Dublin! This afternoon, your Local Guide will take you on a panoramic sightseeing tour. See Dublin Castle, Trinity College, St. Patricks Cathedral, and Phoenix Park. A great introduction to your Irish journey!

View the ruins of the Cistercian Abbey at Boyle, dating back to the 12th century. On to visit the pilgrimage town of Knock in County Mayo, where the Virgin Mary appeared to villagers in 1879. End the day in Sligo.

Travel through beautiful County Donegal. See the harbor town of Mullaghmore, then head to the city of Donegal to see the 15th century castle. Next, visit traditional weavers in Ardara. On across the border into Nothern Ireland for a visit to the Belleek Pottery Factory. Stop at Drumcliffe to view the grave of renowned Irish author W.B. Yeats before returning to your hotel in Sligo.

This morning, travel via Westport and the beautiful region of Connemara to Galway on the banks of the Corrib River. View the Cathedral, built on the site of the old prison, and stroll around Eyre Square. Continue to Limerick, the setting for the film Angelas Ashes. Here, your orientation drive includes views of St. Marys Cathedral and King Johns Castle. Tonight, explore the vibrant city of Limerick on your own, or perhaps join your Travel Director and companions for an optional medieval banquet in an Irish castle.

Drive to the west coast and the magnificent Cliffs of Moher. The history of the cliffs is brought to life with a visit to the Atlantic Edge exhibition. Return to Limerick for free time to explore on your own. You might want to join your Travel Director for an optional excursion to Bunratty Folk Park.

Enjoy a scenic morning drive along the Dingle Peninsula. See the colorful, unspoiled villages and fishing harbors of Irelands most westerly point. Later, arrive in the town of Tralee, famed for its annual Rose of Tralee festival.
On a visit to Blarney Castle, dont miss the chance to kiss the Blarney Stone and acquire the gift of the gab! Arrive later in the Irish capital, Dublin, where your evening is free.
You will be transferred to the airport (conditions apply), where your vacation ends.
Airport transfers in Dublin on Days 2 and 9

TourInfo.Description: As with all our vacations, this itinerary features specially-organized sightseeing and first-hand experiences throughout. Sightseeing, special features and scenic highlights as indicated in the itinerary, including admission charges Hidden Delight A unique experience provided by your Travel Director

strong: You will fly over the International Date Line on your way to Melbourne, Australia.
You will fly over the International Date Line on your way to Melbourne, Australia.
On arrival at Melbourne Airport you are transferred to your hotel (flights to arrive prior to 4 p.m.). This evening meet your Travel Director for a Welcome Reception.
See the Royal Botanic Gardens, the Shrine of Remembrance and more on a sightseeing tour. Later, enjoy time free.
A free day to enjoy this cosmopolitan city.

Transfer to the airport for your flight to Alice Springs. On arrival visit the School of the Air. Later, youll join the Heaslip family for an afternoon tea at Bond Springs Station. Hear about their life working on their 585 square mile cattle grazing property.

Before departing Alice Springs youll visit the Telegraph Station and Royal Flying Doctor Service. Hear from a Local Expert how this marvelous facility operates to provide a mantle of safety to the people of the Outback. This evening enjoy a complimentary glass of wine while watching the spectacular sunset at Uluru (Ayers Rock).

View sunrise at Uluru (Ayers Rock). Then, tour the caves at its base and hear stories of the Aboriginal Dreamtime. Later, youll travel through the desert plains to Kata Tjuta where youll take a walk through Walpa Gorge and gaze down the central valley of Kata Tjuta. Finally, experience a spectacular sunset with complimentary sparkling wine at Kata Tjuta.
You will be transferred to the airport for your flight to the vacation resort of Cairns.

Board a high-speed catamaran for the most unforgettable day on the Great Barrier Reef. Enjoy an informative reef education presentation by a Local Expert. See the fascinating coral formations and other exotic marine life from the underwater observatory and the semisubmersible craft. After a Highlight Lunch, theres time to relax, snorkel or scuba dive (own expense).
Enjoy a free day to do as you choose.
Encounter unique Australian animals at the Cairns Wildlife Dome. Then we will transfer you to the airport to board your flight to Sydney, where the rest of the day is free.

See stunning views of Sydney Harbour and the city skyline on a sightseeing tour, before you join a tour of the Opera House with a Local Expert. Re-board your coach and travel to Bondi Beach for a Youre Personally Invited lunch at an Aussie institution, the Returned Servicemens Club, with its views over the Pacific Ocean. Return to the city for a cruise on the glistening harbor. You will then have the opportunity to learn about Australias national gemstone  the opal.
Enjoy a full free day in exciting Sydney. This evening gather with your Travel Director for a Farewell Dinner on your last day in Australia at a local restaurant by the water.

You will be transferred to the airport to board your morning flight to Auckland. On arrival you will transfer to your hotel. This evening meet your Travel Director for dinner atop Aucklands Skytower at Orbit, a revolving restaurant with 360 degree views of the city.
A morning cruise on Waitemata Harbour is followed by a sightseeing tour including Bastion Point, the War Memorial and Viaduct Harbour, home to the 2000 Americas Cup.

Travel into the Waikato region to visit the incredible Waitomo Glow Worm Grotto for a boat tour with a Local Guide. Then continue to Rotorua where youll visit Te Puia Thermal Reserve, and accompanied by a Local Guide. Finally, enjoy a Youre Personally Invited traditional Maori Hangi dinner accompanied by local wine, and a concert at the Tamaki Family Marae.

You will be transferred to the airport to fly to Christchurch. On arrival board your coach for a tour to see how the city is slowly being rebuilt as a consequence of the devastating earthquake of February 2011.
Journey through the Southern Alps on the TranzAlpine train. At Hokitika visit a local greenstone (jade) factory, a Local Specialty. Continue to Franz Josef Glacier.

Drive over the Haast Pass, past Thunder Creek Falls, Lakes Wanaka, Hawea and Dunstan. Enjoy the tastes of delicious stone fruit at Cromwell, the stone fruit capital and a Local Specialty. Next visit the historic gold mining village of Arrowtown before arriving in adventure-capital Queenstown.

Rise early, then drive along the shores of Lake Wakatipu to Te Anau. Travel through the rainforest of Fiordland National Park and through the hand-hewn Homer Tunnel to abundant photo opportunities afforded by Mirror Lake, Cleddau Valley and the Chasm, en route to Milford Sound to board your cruise including a Highlight Lunch.
A full day to explore Queenstown, your way.

Travel past Mount Cook National Park. Next visit Lake Tekapo stopping at the Church of the Good Shepherd. Join us at Morelea Farm, a typical working sheep farm. You are welcomed into the home of your hosts Angie and Stan to enjoy a Youre Personally Invited lunch in their 600 acre garden and gain an insight into the day to day operation of farm life. Travel over the Canterbury Plains to Christchurch. Join your Travel Director this evening for a Farewell Dinner.
This morning you are transferred to Christchurch Airport for your onward flight.
Airport transfers in Melbourne on Day 3 and Christchurch on Day 24 for guests who have advised Brendan of their flight details
All airport transfers during your guided vacation as indicated in the itinerary

TourInfo.Description: As with all our vacations, this itinerary features specially-organized sightseeing and first-hand experiences throughout. Sightseeing, special features and scenic highlights as indicated in the itinerary, including admission charges Headsets for sightseeing so you can easily hear your guide's commentary Hidden Delight A unique experience provided by your Travel Director

strong: Welcome to Fairbanks! Spend the afternoon getting settled or do a little sightseeing on your own. At 6 p.m., gather at the hotel for a Welcome Reception.

Visit a workshop where local artisans carve Alaskan Birch Bowls, a Local Specialty. Then, board a paddlewheel riverboat to a re-created Athabascan village where you can meet with native Alaskans. Visit the kennel of the late Iditarod champion Susan Butcher and hear a Local Expert recount tales about life as a senior handler on the trail. Enjoy some free time to explore Fairbanks on your own. Tonight, enjoy a Salmon Bake Highlight Dinner.

Wind your way through the scenic Tanana River Valley on your way to Mount McKinley, the highest peak in North America. Settle into your hotel and delve into Denalis lively history at a Highlight Dinner and show at the Denali Dinner Theater.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Denali National Park Sightseeing & Free Time

strong: Perhaps take an optional morning rafting trip or a guided hike; then immerse yourself in the untouched wilderness of Denali as your guide helps you spot local wildlife. Enjoy a light box lunch before heading back for an afternoon of free time.

Enjoy a morning on your own before boarding the famous Alaska Railroad for the scenic journey to Anchorage. Relax in your comfortable reclining seat or visit the panoramic vista dome car as onboard experts discuss the spectacular landscapes of Hurricane Gulch and Indian River Canyon. Arriving in Anchorage, enjoy the evening on your own.

Explore Anchorages historic downtown district and view the scenic shores of Cook Inlet. Stop at the Ulu Factory for a Local Specialty, an introduction to the semicircular ulu knife developed by the Inuit people. Visit the Alaska Native Heritage Center where you can walk along wooded paths past indigenous villages and meet with natives from different parts of the state. After some free time, join your newfound friends at a Farewell Dinner.

ItinerarySegment.Title: Anchorage / Kenai Fjords National Park / Seward

strong: Visit a wildlife rehabilitation center with a guide before embarking on a sightseeing cruise into the heart of Kenai Fjords National Park. Enjoy a prime rib and salmon lunch while enjoying the views of abundant wildlife and magnificent glaciers. Then, bid farewell to your traveling companions sailing off on the 7 night cruise to Vancouver, BC.

Enjoy the morning on your own before returning to Anchorage. Stops will be made at Anchorage Inter- national Airport and the hotel in Anchorage for guests extending their stay. Please do not schedule any flights before 6 p.m.
Airport transfers in Fairbanks on Day 1 and Anchorage on Day 8
